sentences: Jehan de Nuevile (c.1200â€“c.1250) was the second son of the Eustache de Nuevile, a minor nobleman with land in Neuville-Vitasse, near Arras.
He himself was dead by 1254, when his younger brother, Gilles, appears as lord at Neuville.
Also surviving on Jehan's name is a complainte, an Old French variant of the Old Occitan planh, a form rare in northern France.
